intro: Callianthe montana, commonly known as the mountain holly, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of western North America. It is a member of the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and high-altitude environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are leathery and dark green, while the flowers are usually white or pink, appearing in clusters. Callianthe montana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
